roles.note: arg3-domain of unification added based on corpus examples, as it may occur in addition to args 1& 2. (from unification.01-n)

role.descr: second thing unified, if separate from arg1

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: Arguing that the separate financial marketplaces acted as one, and concluding that the crash had ``raised the possibility of a full-scale financial system breakdown,'' the presidential task force called for establishing [a super-regulator]-1 to oversee the markets, to make margins consistent across markets, *trace*-1 to unify clearing systems and to install circuit breakers.

example.name: separate things
example.text: John unified his sense of fair play with Mary's violent tendencies.

example.name: pieces and whole
example.text: [John's sense of fair play and Mary's violent tendencies]-1 were unified *trace*-1 into a very unhealthy living situation.
example.arg: into a very unhealthy living situation

example.name: adjectival
example.text: That's why ``we have been working hard to develop a single, more unified presence in Europe,'' said A.J.C. Smith, Marsh& McLennan's president, at a London news conference yesterday.

example.name: just arg3 and LOC
example.text: the chances for economic unification in the area and economic recovery in Serbia are slim at best .

example.text: Yugoslavs Again Push for Economic Unification of Albania and Yugoslavia.
